programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff are offered an aeroplane propeller linked to aviator Charles Lindbergh, and a key ring alleged to have belonged to singer Willie Nelson.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an antique apple vending machine and a 1920s floor sander.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is excited when a 1950s toy car is brought into the shop, while Ron, Tyler and Brettly hunt for bargains.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Detectives reveal how DNA evidence led them to 15-year-old Nanine Grimes' killer, a quarter of a century after she was stabbed more than 80 times in her Adams County home in September 1980

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Challenging investigations in modern law enforcement, profiling completed cases that were far from straightforward.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction season ends with a record-breaking sale, and Moe chooses the one purchase his wife allows him to make each year.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick examines a 1920s chainsaw and an unusual golf ball dispenser.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly returns from his first solo picking trip with an impressive haul, and Rick asks a former client to help him work out how a 1930s iron lung works.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers are offered a 1941 Philco Radio, Rick Harrison tries to refurbish and sell a vending machine from the 1950s, while Corey authenticates an 18th-century flintlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A man trades a 1750 blunderbuss for an engagement ring, and an ejector seat from a Second World War fighter plane is offered to the team. Documentary following the work of staff at a pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Rumour has it that UFO witnesses have been intimidated into remaining silent about their experiences by mysterious 'Men in Black'. This documentary questions the identity of these ominous enforcers and who they might be working for.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate Puma Punku, the 14,000-year-old complex of interconnecting blocks in western Bolivia, and present computer analysis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man try to buy one of America's most valuable race cars - a 1965 Shelby Cobra - and become interested in a clock from a Second World War ship.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man faces a tough decision when the shop is offered a bottle of Prohibition-era whiskey, Corey buys a hot-air balloon, and a customer tries to sell a classic guitar.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: If I Were a Tibetin' Man
programme.desc: The bidders compete for a potentially profitable furniture locker, while Ricky and Bubba buy a collection of American football autographs, but need to check if they are genuine.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The smiths are tasked with forging Dave Baker's favourite blade, the Scottish Dirk.Two head on to the final round, to recreate the German Halberd, a medieval-era triple threat.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick questions the authenticity of a German bayonet supposedly from the Second World War, and considers whether a petrol pump from the 1930s with a bird's nest inside is worth restoring. Corey takes a quiz after misidentifying a Faberge crystal egg - if he loses he works the graveyard shift, but if he wins he gets $2,500

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars deliberate over a chopped 1929 Ford Coupe and a mechanical calving rope. Plus, fed up with one employee arriving late, the Old Man hunts for a fitting punishment.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Files in Hangar 1 reveal Native American stories of beings they referred to as 'Star People' opening up the possibility that tribal lands have hosted interstellar visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A team of experts looks into the Orion constellation to investigate whether this could have been an entry point for aliens visiting Earth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. All hell breaks loose when Ashley puts a rare Olympic torch from Seth's personal collection up for sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley faces the consequences of her rash decision, Seth takes a ride in a hovercraft and Les does business with Muhammad Ali Jr.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to West Covina in California, where Jarrod and Brandi bring in an expert to sniff out the best lockers and Darrell and Brandon help everyone dress for success.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary faces stiff opposition as she tries to turn a bad day around with a great locker, as everyone is out to make big bucks at auctions in Riverside.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee produces 'pawn shop pinot' using a 19th-century winemaker, and Rick inspects a lorry that looks set to become the priciest item to enter the business.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team procures a quilt made from celebrity autographs, and a Sweeney Todd-style barber's chair arrives at the store.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: From Rasputin to the Nazis, many people throughout history are believed to have tapped into dark powers. This programme considers the validity of such claims.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The search for an alleged UFO thought to have crashed in Aurora, Texas in 1897. Locals claimed they buried the craft and its alien pilot, so investigators dig for evidence of the claim.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedian and actor Miles Jupp, chef extraordinaire Heston Blumenthal, actress Emilia Fox and funnyman Ed Byrne are this week's guests.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts the comedy quiz, with guests Chris Addison, Ed Byrne, Micky Flanagan and Diane Morgan joining panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on world events in an edition from 2011.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that may be the truth or may be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and Rimmer finally arrive back on Earth, only to discover they have slipped through a time hole into a period where everything occurs backwards. Sci-fi space comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A prankster boyfriend whose jokes have gone too far with his girlfriend arrives in court. Plus, a car seller and his friend's stupidity has landed him in front of the judge.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: In the final episode, a man's stag dos have come between him and his fiancee, and an amateur burlesque group come to the court for compensation.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, writer and actor Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Man In The Iron Mask
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the story of the man in the iron mask, who was held in the Bastille from 1698 to 1703, and may have been imprisoned for 40 years.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden history of the stately home in Derbyshire, the residence of the dukes of Devonshire, revealing tales of intrigue, tragedy and scandal.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The Wieliczka Salt mine in southern Poland, some 327 metres deep, where the voids left behind from excavating salt have been transformed into extraordinary spaces, carved by hand.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. DS Boyd is approached by a woman convinced her father's death in a car crash was not an accident or suicide, but something far more sinister. Intrigued by the evidence she has collected, he agrees to re-open the case, and with the help of forensic scientist Dr Frankie Wharton, investigates a third option not previously considered. Trevor Eve and Holly Aird star.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The fire-fighting team faces a race against time as it struggles to save a girl trapped in a silo. Meanwhile, Bayleaf is sent up a crane to talk a suicidal boy down.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Katrina continues to fight Kilwillie for the local council seat, while Archie and Lexie struggle to deliver a grouse in time for a special dinner at Archie's London restaurant.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company is sent to New Zealand for a training exercise, where Paddy and Dave take a new recruit under their wing. Guest starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy, Dave and Vinny have a romantic reunion with their wives before the day of exercise with live ammunition begins. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kezia and Smithy work together on a courier van hijack and soon get a result, but later find themselves in trouble for scaring one of Keith Durante's rape victims. James Tennant's fiancee turns up at the station with news that he has evidence of the whereabouts of his missing daughter Amy, but it's clear that seven months of frantic searching have left him a broken man.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric visits Jess and her newborn baby in hospital, where he tells her he is no longer moving to Ghana. However, her condition deteriorates and he is forced to set aside his differences with Zubin as they fight to save her in the operating theatre. Meanwhile, Dean tries to deter Donna from going on another date with Sean, and Mubbs makes an effort to remain calm at work.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Affairs of the heart dominate the lives of the staff as Duffy looks for a shoulder to cry on, while Ash admits he and Laura are splitting up and Tina receives tragic news. Meanwhile, the rest of the team attempt to get Charlie to the church on time. Conclusion of a two-part story, starring Brenda Fricker, Clive Mantle, Cathy Shipton and Patrick Robinson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the disaster, Reg is overwhelmed with grief at the loss of his soul mate, Neil bottles up his feelings and Gabriel is hailed as a hero for rescuing Dale. With MIT and the anti-terrorism squad crawling over the burnt-out shell of the Sun Hill station, Tony Stamp investigates a link between Colin Fairfax and a local extremist group suggesting the perpetrator was close to home. June adjusts to life without Jim, and Leela faces hostility from the Asian community.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel tries to step into Steve's shoes and Dot finds a new recruit for her carol singers. The new-look Queen Vic opens its doors for the first time since the fire.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline confronts Mrs Hewitt, and Mark finds out the truth between Michelle and Clyde. Dot has a disappointment and Steve makes a peace offering to Hattie.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to a terrible motorway accident. Elsewhere, Bayleaf realizes that Karen has kidnapped Melanie. Starring James Hazeldine.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie makes a quick trip to London with Lexie and a cargo of grouse to prepare a special Highland dinner at his restaurant, and a helicopter and an ice-cream van contribute to a disaster. Dawn Steele and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Part one of two. Returning to Jersey after extended leave, Jim is devastated when Susan's body is washed up on the shore the morning after she attends an international trade fair on the island. The detective faces an uphill struggle to convince his colleagues that the death is suspicious - and not just an unfortunate accident. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian has his poems published, so buys gifts for all the family. Oswald wonders whether he has made the right decision by proposing to Aveline, and Joey discovers he is a father.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Jeffrey's wife sends her new boyfriend to the camp to ask him for a divorce. When the professor is unwilling to co-operate, the pair begin digging for evidence. Classic comedy, starring Simon Cadell, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean begins to think that, 19 months after tying the knot, her marriage may have become stale. She wonders whether a few surprises from Lionel would spice things up, so Alistair, helped by Judith and Sandy, comes up with a plan to give her the treat of a lifetime.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: All That Glitters Is Not Elvis
programme.desc: When Alvin and Entwistle witness Lance attempting to prove to his wife that Elvis Presley is still alive, the duo feel duty-bound to help him out, and organise for the King himself to make an appearance. Long-running comedy starring Brian Murphy, Burt Kwouk and Kenneth Cope.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: An alien species intent on wiping out the human race invades Toronto, and Crabtree becomes humanity's last hope for salvation. Non-canon Halloween special.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard is struck down with a tropical disease and Camille is in Paris, so when a diver's body is found in shallow waters, with peculiar markings on his chest, Dwayne and Fidel have to solve this tricky case themselves. To add to their problems, a holidaying British cop pokes her nose in - and she is even more annoying than the out-of-sorts DI. Caribbean crime drama, starring Danny John-Jules, Gary Carr and Ben Miller, with guest appearances from Shirley Henderson and Lisa Faulkner.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra's private and professional worlds become intertwined when her mother has a fall that means she needs to go into a care home. Her first choice is revealed to be the scene of a suspicious death a year earlier, leading Jack, Gerry and Brian to go undercover at the home. Drama, guest starring June Whitfield, Sheila Hancock and Gwyneth Strong.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: When a skull is found buried in concrete in a church crypt, Boyd seeks to uncover who it belongs to and why it is there, but gets little help from the Church authorities, who seem focused on obscuring the facts. The discovery of another body, adorned with ritualistic symbols, leads the team to a suspicious workman and an uncooperative retired priest. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in a feature-length episode, with guest appearances by Annette Crosbie and Barry Morse.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore talks to Piers about his career and personal life, including his spectacular fall from grace in the early 2000s when 31-year-old Stuart Lubbock was found dead in his swimming pool following a party at his home. Barrymore was never charged in relation to the death, but the controversy has dogged his career ever since and he has rarely been seen on television, besides a successful appearance in the 2006 edition of Celebrity Big Brother, where he finished as runner-up. He also talks about his close friendship with Princess Diana, the depths of his drug and alcohol addictions and the moment in which he came out as gay.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney throws a dinner party for four strangers at her Essex home. Brian McFadden hosts the game show where diners try to guess the identity of a mystery host holding a dinner party in order to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Inside MI5: Keeping The UK Safe - Tonight
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo gains access to MI5, one of the world's oldest and most-renowned spy agencies. Filmed as London experienced two terror attacks at Fishmonger's Hall and Streatham, Tonight sees the engine room of the UK's fight against terror. Surveillance officers and investigators also discuss their secret work and its impact on their lives.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Magician Darcy Oake joins Ben Shephard and Kate Garraway in the studio ahead of his new tour - and makes Kate disappear. Plus, Gene Kelly's widow Patrica Ward Kelly talks about her husband's legacy, a new statue in his honour and Singin' in the Rain back in cinemas.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Hertfordshire calling themselves Herts & Minds join forces to tackle the quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis. They answer questions about top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mike, Hilary, Terry and Alex pit their wits against the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas becomes suspicious that something is not right, Mandy finds herself seeking forgiveness and planning begins for Graham's funeral.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff returns home and rails at Yasmeen for failing to have his dinner on the table, and when she explains she was cleaning out the chicken coop and lost track of time, his mood darkens. Sally invites Kevin round for dinner with Abi before heading off to Sarah's hen night and leaving them to sort out their differences, and Tracy urges Steve to up their offer on the house in the hope that it'll top Peter's bid.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Following the suicide of Jeanie Long, the woman convicted of the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier, new evidence comes to light exonerating her. DCI Vera Stanhope reinvestigates the case, but to find out who really killed Abigail, the detective must uncover the secrets of a close-knit community that is still coming to terms with the incident. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Telling Tales, guest starring Hugo Speer alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Wunmi Mosaku and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: It's Movie Week as the remaining celebrities and their partners battle it out to stay in the competition and secure a place in the semi-final. Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean head up the ice panel, alongside Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman, and there's a performance from Luke Evans alongside the professional skaters. Hosted by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the amazing, and massive, decorations on Mardi Gras carnival floats are created, how rock candy is twisted together, and a look at how dentures are made.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: After purchasing a badly modified DeSoto Firedome, Mike Brewer and Edd China set about addressing the damage to give the stunning cruiser back some of its class.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Robbie prepares for the biggest house move in the family's career. Plus, Jason must transport a massive cargo into the Outback with only a narrow window of clear weather.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Michigan Bike/My Name Is Earl - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mikey Teutul unveils the bike for the University of Michigan children's hospital, and the whole team goes to Hollywood for a party with the cast of My Name Is Earl.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A U-Haul full of parts and a dream of a perfect Plymouth Business Coupe show up at the shop. However, Dan's priority is to find a 1972 Gran Sport to restore.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe learns first-hand how hard it is to manufacture potato crisps, before carrying out an unpleasant job in the Colorado town of Rifle.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of turntables, steam engines, playground equipment and non-stick pans.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of garden forks, English toffee, paint chip cards and Bundt pans, and how processes have developed through the years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in turning scrap metal into luxury cookers. Plus, the hand-rolling of billions of sticks of incense, and the creation of jenever - the original form of gin.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The opilio crab season begins and the newly repaired Cornelia Marie is pushed hard by a dual storm system that almost claims two of the Time Bandit's crew.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Pressure mounts as the days get warmer. Meanwhile, after months of work without taking time to grieve his best friend's death, Zeke reaches his breaking-point.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Robbie prepares for the biggest house move in the family's career. Plus, Jason must transport a massive cargo into the Outback with only a narrow window of clear weather.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore a classic 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue their project to get a 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi in prime condition to go back out on the road.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares for the Monterey car show and gets his 1952 Muntz Jet out of storage to ready it for sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is asked by a car enthusiast to sell a Maserati Bora and an S2 Bentley convertible.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Three hundred miles south of the Arctic Circle, Cathy and Larry battle freezing temperatures that threaten to disrupt their supply of fresh water.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Cornelia Marie sets a course back to land to undergo repairs, while fatigue causes mistakes aboard the Northwestern, and greenhorn Moi clashes with Captain Keith on the Wizard.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The dredgers race to put in one last dive before the ice melts from under them. Later, Emily takes drastic measures to earn her crew's self-respect - but will it pay off?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles with a dealer at an Elizabethan manor house, is blown away by a jet engine in a Welsh museum and meets an old friend in Sheffield.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Mark prepares a massive load travelling from South Australia all the way to a tiny island in Micronesia. Plus, Mick transports a curious giraffe through Sydney traffic.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: After purchasing a badly modified DeSoto Firedome, Mike Brewer and Edd China set about addressing the damage to give the stunning cruiser back some of its class.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Michigan, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a 1985 Cadillac, but what they really want is a pump. Then, they're shown a barn-fresh 1931 Ford Model A tow truck that is so rare it could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team discovers a documented Nazi presence and an underground U-Boat base in the Canary Islands, and contemplates whether Hitler may have stopped there on his way to South America.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: After a tragic event on their way to a Guarani village, the team secures vital information from the village elders about a special stone hidden near the 'Demon Falls'.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the world's most expensive tea is harvested and treated. Plus, how the Siekierki power plant of Warsaw, Poland, manages to heat half the city's homes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary reveals how a classic British bike is being rebooted in India, and how radiation is used to beat art fraud.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Mark Bridger: The Killer in the Village
programme.desc: The case of five-year-old April Jones, who in 2012 disappeared while playing with friends in a Welsh village. DS Andy John recalls the hunt for her killer, who turned out to be 46-year-old local man Mark Bridger.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists reconstruct the scene of a bludgeoning in Georgia, USA, in an attempt to track down the suspect in a murder investigation.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of 13-year-old Cindy Zarzycki, who disappeared in 1986 on the way to a Detroit ice-cream parlour. In 2008, her killer finally revealed where he buried her body after he raped and killed her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of self-made millionaire Buddy Parker's 26-year-old daughter Tara Swilley, who died after the carpet company owner's home was raked with gunfire by an embittered business associate in August 2004.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents notice a pattern emerging when they investigate a series of violent carjackings around Washington DC in 1992.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The vets risk their lives by rushing to the aid of the people and pets of Flagstaff, Arizona, which is in the grip of a raging forest fire.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Lewis tries to solve a mysterious condition on a dog. Plus, at Perth Zoo Dr Peter looks after an elephant and Dr Danni helps a dog with a suspected twisted stomach.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who lost her mother to breast cancer battles her opinionated aunt, while Ellen falls for a dress that might be beyond her means.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: No-nonsense bride Amy knows what she wants - will she trust David to take the reins? Control freak Emily wants an open-back gown that gets the tears flowing.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Coffs Harbour where he visits Dolphin Marine Magic, and explores one of the greatest friendships between man and animal.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators responds to reports of animal cruelty, rescuing pets and dealing with abusive owners.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators are called out after disturbing reports of a large number of dogs held captive in makeshift pens. Octavio Gonzales receives a call about an abandoned horse.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A leather jacket, a bird cage, a Japanese instrument and some fabric from south-east Asia are all in line for a make-over as Sarah Moore and Jay Blades save them from the homes of TV personality and celebrity chef Rustie Lee and former newsreader Jan Leeming. Narrated by Arthur Smith.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The disturbing methods of female killers, who often take a less violent approach to murder than their male counterparts but can prove just as ruthless.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-three Patty Vaughan, whose blood-stained minivan was found abandoned at a roadside on Christmas Day 1996, 20 miles from her home in Texas. Police considered the possible involvement of her ex-husband in her disappearance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Felipe Santos, who vanished in 2003 after police in Naples, Florida, caught him driving illegally. The investigation became more complicated a year later when Terrance Williams vanished from the same area in identical circumstances.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of 16-year-old Bristol student Becky Watts. When she vanished in February 2015, suspicion fell on her step-brother Nathan Matthews and his partner Shauna Hoare. Experts analyse police interviews for the clues that proved compelling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride with a love of dressing up is torn between a classical dress and a princess gown, while another customer wants to combine a traditional Irish look with modern decorations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress for a New Year wedding, but her mother keeps interfering. A midwifery student looks forward to wearing a glamorous dress on her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A wedding planner visits the shop while arranging her own big day, and has a long list of requirements. Another bride has a difference of opinions with her sister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride plans a wedding in Cyprus in which everything must be pink - including her frock. Another customer want to wear a sparkly dress when she gets married in Mexico.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A West End actress wants to wear a traditional dress when she gets married at St Paul's Cathedral, while another customer is in search of something theatrical.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride clashes with her friends over the right kind of dress for a wedding on a beach, while another customer prepares for her final fitting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard travels to Woodlands Castle in Somerset, where he finds vintage toys. He also visits a reclamation yard in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A leather jacket, a bird cage, a Japanese instrument and some fabric from south-east Asia are all in line for a make-over as Sarah Moore and Jay Blades save them from the homes of TV personality and celebrity chef Rustie Lee and former newsreader Jan Leeming. Narrated by Arthur Smith.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with Angel, whose knee pain threatens her future, and Charity, who is pursuing her old goals again after post-surgery complications.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: A shooting in broad daylight that left two people dead in 2007. The investigators had a number of suspects and an unexpected lead pointed them in the right direction.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A case in which a family objected to an autopsy of a man who died in a fall on religious grounds. Plus, a florist's death that proved puzzling.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The crimes of Hannegret Donnelly, who battered husband Christopher to death with 78 visible injuries in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire. In court, it transpired she had been abusing him at home for years.
